entry.title: Notes on Mojolicious
entry.content:
Will keep notes of some of the mojo tips I got.

1.A helper command to generate app for us.

pl mojo generate app This will generate Mojolicious application directory structure.

pl mojo generate lite_app This will generate Mojolicious::Lite application for us.

pl mojo generate lite_app hello This will generate the app with the name “hello”

2.about deploying your app to heroku

pl cpanm Mojolicious::Command::deploy::heroku mojo generate lite_app bigfan ./bigfan deploy heroku --create or we can assign our app name like the following: ./bigfan deploy heroku -n bigfan

3.In mojo, something like “hello.html.ep”, here “ep” stands for “embedded perl”, we can have html.ep, json.ep, txt.ep.

4.Three kinds of placeholders.

generic placeholders:

pl get '/:fname/:lname' => sub{ shift->render('capture); };

relaxed placeholders:

pl get '/:fname/(.lname)' => sub{ shift->render('capture); };

wildcard placeholders:

pl get '/:fname/(*lname)' => sub{ shift->render('capture); };
